page.title: 05The Norfolk Bridge
page.content: In May 1833,a suspension bridge which spanned the River Adur was opened to transport.It was built as a toll bridge,and was paid for by the Duke of Norfolk,who collected the tolls.A British Civil Engineer called William Tierney Clark designed it,(he is also known to have designed the bridges over the Thames at Marlow and Hammersmith).The bridge had large arches on top of which a lion and a horse were erected.However in 1922-1923 a new bridge was built and the lion and the horse were taken down and placed at Arundel Castle where they can now be seen. This new bridge was a massive steel work structure consisting of four spans of riveted bow spring and cost over Â£40,000.On 28 April 1927 it was opened by Lord Leconfield,and carried traffic along the old line of the
